bibl.title: Letter from Frank F. Law to Philip Showalter Hench, March 19, 1948

div1.p: Law informs Hench that he has offered to loan the Cornwell painting for the Fourth International Congress on Tropical Medicine.

div1.head: Letter from Frank F. Law to Philip Showalter Hench, March 19, 1948
div1.opener:
WYETH
INCORPORATED
1600 ARCH STREET · PHILADELPHIA 3, PA.
March 19, 1948
OFFICE OF VICE PRESIDENT
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
In reply to your letter of March 16, I have written
to Colonel Dart and if he is interested in using the
painting, Mr. Roley will be glad to work with him.

I greatly appreciate the information relative to Dr.
Noone and think it is very kind of you to offer to intro-
duce him at the Foundation Office, if they are interested
in his application.

Your question concerning publication of Dr. Fitz'
talk at the unveiling of the Oliver Wendell Holmes paint-
ing has been referred to Mr. Roley, and if there has been
publication he will send you copies of the addresses.
With kind personal regards, I am
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Frank F. Law FFL:s
P.S. I have just received your letter of the 17th, which
I am forwarding to Dr. Noone.
Wyeth
